docs.name: Vocat API
docs.info: Vocat is a teaching and learning platform that facilitates qualitative and quantitative assessment of a range of media. Built as a collaboration between the Center for Teaching and Learning at Baruch College, City University of New York and Cast Iron Coding of Portland, Oregon, the tool is in active development.
docs.copyright: Copyright 2015 Baruch College, City University of New York

annotations.name: Annotations
annotations.full_description: Annotations are the comments that users record about a specific media object. If the media being annotated has duration (video or audio media), then the annotation will typically be tied to a specific timestamp on the media. The ID of the user who creates the annotation will be assigned to the parameter author_id property. The API does not currently allow the creation of annotations authored by other users.

methods.name: index

apis.short_description: returns all annotations for an asset

errors.description: The user is not authorized to view this asset.

params.name: asset
params.description: The annotated asset ID

examples:
Sample Response: [ { "id": 11677, "asset_id": 4542, "author_id": 4470, "body": "

Annotation text...

", "published": true, "seconds_timecode": 5.200322, "smpte_timecode": "00:00:05", "author_name": "Ressie Crona", "canvas": "{"json":null,"svg":null}", "current_user_can_destroy": true, "current_user_can_edit": true, "gravatar": "http://gravatar.com/avatar/4c3fe1bdae8ec9e5db97d02aa4cf1cda.png?d=mm&s=", "author_role": "evaluator", "created_at": "5/05/15 03:07PM", "created_at_timestamp": 1430852856, "body_raw": "Annotation text..." }, { "id": 11678, "asset_id": 4542, "author_id": 4470, "body": "

Another annotation...

", "published": true, "seconds_timecode": 11.143548, "smpte_timecode": "00:00:11", "author_name": "Ressie Crona", "canvas": "{"json":null,"svg":null}", "current_user_can_destroy": true, "current_user_can_edit": true, "gravatar": "http://gravatar.com/avatar/4c3fe1bdae8ec9e5db97d02aa4cf1cda.png?d=mm&s=", "author_role": "evaluator", "created_at": "5/05/15 03:12PM", "created_at_timestamp": 1430853139, "body_raw": "Another annotation..." } ]

errors.description: The annotation does not exist.
The user is not authorized to view the annotation.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the annotation to be shown

examples:
Sample Response: { "id": 11678, "asset_id": 4542, "author_id": 4470, "body": "

Another annotation...

", "published": true, "seconds_timecode": 11.143548, "smpte_timecode": "00:00:11", "author_name": "Ressie Crona", "canvas": "{"json":null,"svg":null}", "current_user_can_destroy": true, "current_user_can_edit": true, "gravatar": "http://gravatar.com/avatar/4c3fe1bdae8ec9e5db97d02aa4cf1cda.png?d=mm&s=", "author_role": "evaluator", "created_at": "5/05/15 03:12PM", "created_at_timestamp": 1430853139, "body_raw": "Another annotation..." }

methods.name: create

errors.description: The user is not authorized to annotate the asset to which the annotation belongs.
A required annotation parameter is missing.

params.name: body
params.description: The body of the annotation; support markdown text

params.name: canvas
params.description: A JSON string that includes the json and svg representation of any drawings included in the annotation

params.name: smpte_timecode
params.description: A SMPTE formatted timecode (HH:MM:SS) pointing at the playback time that the annotation relates to

params.name: published
params.description: Whether or not the annotation is published [not currently used]
params.validator: Must be one of: true, false.

params.name: seconds_timecode
params.description: The value of this parameter should be the seconds at which the annotation occurs, to multiple decimal places. If the annotated asset does not have duration, this should be set to 0.0.

params.name: asset_id
params.description: The ID of the asset that has been annotated

examples:
Sample Request: { "body": "Another annotation...", "canvas": "{"json":null,"svg":null}", "published": true, "seconds_timecode": 11.143548, "smpte_timecode": "00:00:11", "asset_id": 4542 } Sample Response: { "id": 11680, "asset_id": 4542, "author_id": 4470, "body": "

Another annotation...

", "published": true, "seconds_timecode": 11.143548, "smpte_timecode": "00:00:11", "author_name": "Ressie Crona", "canvas": "{"json":null,"svg":null}", "current_user_can_destroy": true, "current_user_can_edit": true, "gravatar": "http://gravatar.com/avatar/4c3fe1bdae8ec9e5db97d02aa4cf1cda.png?d=mm&s=", "author_role": "evaluator", "created_at": "5/05/15 07:49PM", "created_at_timestamp": 1430869781, "body_raw": "Another annotation..." }

methods.name: update

errors.description: The annotation does not exist.
The user is not authorized to update the annotation.
A required annotation parameter is missing.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the annotation to be updated

params.name: body
params.description: The body of the annotation; support markdown text

params.name: canvas
params.description: A JSON string that includes the json and svg representation of any drawings included in the annotation

params.name: smpte_timecode
params.description: A SMPTE formatted timecode (HH:MM:SS) pointing at the playback time that the annotation relates to

params.name: published
params.description: Whether or not the annotation is published [not currently used]
params.validator: Must be one of: true, false.

params.name: seconds_timecode
params.description: The value of this parameter should be the seconds at which the annotation occurs, to multiple decimal places. If the annotated asset does not have duration, this should be set to 0.0.

params.name: asset_id
params.description: The ID of the asset that has been annotated

examples:
Sample Request:

{
  "id" : 1,
  "body": "Another updated annotation...",
  "canvas": "{"json":null,"svg":null}",
  "published": true,
  "seconds_timecode": 11.143548,
  "smpte_timecode": "00:00:11",
  "asset_id": 4542
}

errors.description: The annotation does not exist.
The user is not authorized to delete the annotation.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the annotation to be deleted

assets.name: Assets
assets.full_description: Assets are any type of media that can be attached to submissions. Vocat currently understands multiple asset types including audio, image, video, vimeo, and youtube assets. Media that Vocat cannot understand is given an asset type of unknown.

methods.name: show

apis.short_description: shows a single asset and its associated attachment, and annotations

errors.description: The user is not authorized to view this asset.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the asset to show

examples:

methods.name: create

errors.description: The user is not authorized to attach an asset to this submission.
A required asset parameter is missing.

params.name: id
params.description: The asset ID

params.name: submission_id
params.description: The ID of the submission with which this asset is associated

params.name: listing_order_position
params.description: The position of this asset among other assets associated with the same submission

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the asset

params.name: external_source
params.description: If the asset references an external asset, the external_source should specify what service hosts the asset
params.validator: Must be one of: youtube, vimeo.

params.name: external_location
params.description: The identifier of the asset at an exteranl source. For example, if the asset is a YouTube video, this would be the YouTube ID

params.name: attachment_attributes
params.description: Attachment attributes

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of an attachment object that should be attached to this asset

examples:
Sample Request:

{
    "name": "A sample asset",
    "listing_order": 0,
    "submission_id": 7395,
    "external_source": "youtube",
    "external_location": "PiqepG5GDZI"
}

{

attachments.name: Attachments
attachments.full_description: Attachments represent the actual files that are attached to assets. There is a one-to-one relationship between assets and attachments. Typically, an attachment file is uploaded directly from the client to Vocat's storage backend, which will usually be S3. The attachment object is created prior to the upload starting. When the upload, which is generally an asynchronous upload, has completed, the attachment object is updated to store the location of the uploaded file resource. At the end of the process, the attachment is attached to an asset object.

methods.name: create

errors.description: The user is not authorized to create an attachment.
A required attachment parameter is missing.

params.name: media_file_name
params.description: The name of the file being uploaded. This field is not currently used in Vocat.

methods.name: show

errors.description: The user is not authorized to view this attachment.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the attachment to be shown

examples:
Sample Response:

{
    "id": 4871,
    "current_user_can_destroy": false,
    "state": "uncommitted",
    "s3_upload_document": {
        "policy": "hdC5kZXYifSxbInN0YXJ0cy13aXRoIiwiJGtleSIsInRlbXBvcmFyeS9hdHRhY2htZW50LzQwMDBfNTAYW5nZSIsMCw1MzY4NzA5MTIwXV19",

    },

}

courses.name: Courses
courses.full_description: Courses are containers for projects, and memberships. A course has many members, and members can be of the type creator, evaluator, or assistant. Courses also have group projects, user projects, and open projects. Courses also may contain one or more groups. The courses API is still relatively immature. It is not currently possible to create memberships through courses, although this is on the roadmap and may be developed as the need arises. Course creation typically happens via the creation of course request objects, which are not currently exposed via the API.

methods.name: index

apis.short_description: returns all courses in which the current user is a member

examples:
Sample Response:

[
   {
      "id":234,
      "department":"CIS",
      "description":"Consequuntur est consequatur laborum est ea enim. Temporibus. Libero consequatur accusantium vero voluptas tempore.",
      "name":"Computer Information Systems",
      "number":"3810",
      "section":"X07SO",
      "organization_id":1,
      "role":"evaluator",
      "semester_name":"Winter",
      "year":2015
   },
   {
      "id":235,
      "department":"ENG",
      "description":"Rerum esse cupiditate. Deleniti animi exercitationem officiis beatae excepturi. Repudiandae ratione aut quos qui quam esse dignissimos.",
      "name":"Composition I",
      "number":"2100",
      "section":"ACCMR",
      "organization_id":1,
      "role":"evaluator",
      "semester_name":"Spring",
      "year":2015
   },
   {
      "id":237,
      "department":"ENG",
      "description":"Enim perferendis placeat quas. Quia praesentium quis non. Repellendus voluptates delectus non magnam ex.",
      "name":"Great Works of Literature",
      "number":"2850",
      "section":"8ISRX",
      "organization_id":1,
      "role":"evaluator",
      "semester_name":"Summer",
      "year":2015
   }
]

methods.name: show

errors.description: The user is not authorized to view this course, perhaps because he/she is not enrolled in it.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the course to be returned

examples:
Sample Response:

{
    "id": 234,
    "department": "CIS",
    "description": "Consequuntur est consequatur laborum est ea enim. Libero consequatur accusantium vero voluptas tempore.",
    "name": "Computer Information Systems",
    "number": "3810",
    "section": "X07SO",
    "organization_id": 1,
    "role": "evaluator",
    "semester_name": "Winter",
    "year": 2015
}

methods.name: update

errors.description: The user is not authorized to update the course. Only admins and course evaluators/assistants may update courses.

params.name: id
params.description: The course ID

params.name: department
params.description: The department offering the course (for example, “ENG”)

params.name: number
params.description: The course number

params.name: name
params.description: The human readable course name

params.name: section
params.description: The course section number

params.name: year
params.description: The year in which the course takes place

params.name: description
params.description: A fulltext description of the course

params.name: semester_id
params.description: The ID of the semester in which the course takes place

params.name: message
params.description: A course message, visible to students in the course

params.name: groups_attribute
params.description: An array of course groups; each item in the array is a hash with a name attribute (string) and a creator_ids attrtibute (fixnums)
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

examples:
Sample Request:

{
  "id": 234,
  "department": "CIS",
  "description": "Updated description....",
  "name": "Updated Course Name",
  "number": "3810",
  "section": "X07SO",
  "organization_id": 1,
  "role": "evaluator",
  "semester_name": "Winter",
  "year": 2015
}

discussion_posts.name: Discussion posts
discussion_posts.full_description: Discussion Posts appear on submission detail views. A post can be threaded, and can have another discussion posts as its parent. As with annotations, the author_id value of a discussion post is set to the user who creates the post. The API does not currently provide a mechanism for creating discussion posts that belong to other users.

methods.name: index

apis.short_description: returns all discussion posts for a given submission

methods.full_description: Nota Bene: the posts are returned in a flat array. It is the responsibility of the client application to structure the posts into a parent/child hierarchy based on the parent_id.

params.name: submission
params.description: The ID of the submission to query for discussion posts

examples:
Sample Response: [ { "id":1816, "author_id":4470, "author_name":"Ressie Crona", "body":"

This is the body of the post. Markdown is supported

enrollments.name: Enrollments
enrollments.full_description: Enrollments are a psuedo-resource that represents a user's membership in a given course. In general, course enrollment can be managed by course evaluators, course assistants, and Vocat administrators. Bulk enrollment is possible using the bulk enrollment endpoint. During bulk enrollment, users who are not currently known to Vocat may be invited via email.

methods.name: index

apis.short_description: returns users enrolled in a given course
returns courses in which a given user is enrolled

methods.full_description: Only admins and evaluator users may see what courses a user is enrolled in. Any user who is enrolled in a course may view which other users are enrolled in that course.

errors.description: The requested course or user does not exist.
The user is not authorized to view enrollments for this course or user.

params.name: course_id
params.description: The course's ID

params.name: user_id
params.description: The user's ID

params.name: role
params.description: Filter enrollments by course role; only available when getting enrollments by course. If this is unset, all enrollments for the course will be returned.
params.validator: Must be one of: evaluator, creator, assistant.

examples:
Sample Response

  [
     {
        "id":"u4473c234",
        "user":4473,
        "email":"assistant2@test.com",
        "last_sign_in_at":"never",

methods.name: destroy

apis.short_description: removes a user from a course

methods.full_description: Only course evaluators/assistants and Vocat administrators may remove users from courses.

errors.description: Unable to remove the user from the course
Authenticated user is not authorized to mange enrollment for this course.

params.name: enrollment_key
params.description: The enrollment key is a string that takes the format of uXcY where X is the ID of the user to be de-enrolled, and Y is the ID of the course from which to de-enroll the user. If, for example, you wanted to remove User #10 from Course #234, the enrollment key would be u10c234

methods.name: create

apis.short_description: enrolls a single user in a single course

errors.description: Authenticated user is not authorized to mange enrollment for this course.
Unable to add the user to the course, perhaps because the user is already enrolled

params.name: course
params.description: The course's ID

params.name: user
params.description: The user's ID

params.name: role
params.description: The course role that will be assigned to the user
params.validator: Must be one of: evaluator, assistant, creator.

examples:
Sample Request:

{
    "course": 234,
    "user": 4472,
    "role": "evaluator"
}
Sample Response:

{
    "id": "u4472c235",
    "user": 4472,
    "email": "assistant1@test.com",
    "last_sign_in_at": "never",
    "role": "evaluator",
    "course": 235,
    "user_name": "Gusikowski, Toni",
    "course_name": "[ACCMR] ENG2100: Composition I, Spring 2015",
    "section": "ACCMR"
}

methods.name: bulk

apis.short_description: bulk enrolls multiple users in a course

errors.description: Authenticated user is not authorized to mange enrollment for this course.

params.name: course_id
params.description: The course's ID

params.name: role
params.description: The course role that will be assigned to the user
params.validator: Must be one of: evaluator, assistant, creator.

params.name: invite
params.description: Whether or not to invite users who do not exist in Vocat. If false, users who do not exist will not be invited.
params.validator: Must be one of: true, false.

params.name: contacts
params.description: Each line of the string represents a single user to enroll in the course. Each line can be formatted as “FirstName LastName, Email” or “FirstName LastName <email>”

examples:
Sample Request:

{
    "user": 4472,
    "role": "creator",
    "invite": true,
    "contacts": "Jimbo Baggins, jim@castironcoding.com\nBoomBoom Robinson, boomboom@vocat.io"
}
Sample Response:

[
   {
      "email":"jim@castironcoding.com",
      "first_name":"Jimbo",
      "last_name":"Baggins",
      "action":"invite",
      "success":true,
      "reason":null,
      "message":"Jimbo Baggins has been enrolled in ENG2100: Composition I, Section ACCMR",
      "string":"Jimbo Baggins, jim@castironcoding.com"
   },
   {
      "email":"boomboom@vocat.io",
      "first_name":"BoomBoom",
      "last_name":"Robinson",
      "action":"invite",
      "success":true,
      "reason":null,
      "message":"BoomBoom Robinson has been enrolled in ENG2100: Composition I, Section ACCMR",
      "string":"BoomBoom Robinson, boomboom@vocat.io"
   }
]

evaluations.name: Evaluations
evaluations.full_description: Evaluations are created by users for submissions. There can only be one evaluation for each submission/evaluator combination. An evaluation is owned by the user who creates it. The actual score fields in evaluations are dependent on what rubric is used, and these values are accordingly stored in a flexible HSTORE field type.

methods.name: index

apis.short_description: returns all visible evaluations for a given submission

methods.full_description: This endpoint returns only those evaluations that are visible to the authenticated user. Furthermore, the authenticated user must have read access to the submission. Evaluators can see all evaluations for submissions within their courses. Creators can see all published evaluations on submissions they own. Peers can only see their own evaluations. Note that the exact fields returned in the response are dependent on what rubric is being used for the submission project.

errors.description: The submission was not found.
The current user does not have read access to this submission.

params.name: submission_id
params.description: The submission's ID

groups.name: Groups
groups.full_description: Groups are collections of students that are tied to a course. Groups may create submissions for group projects and/or open projects.

methods.name: create

apis.short_description: creates a new group within a course

errors.description: The current user is not allowed to create groups in this course.
A Group or User was not found.
There was an error creating the group. Perhaps not all creators in the group are enrolled in the course?

params.name: id
params.description: The group's ID

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the group

params.name: course_id
params.description: The ID of the course to which the group belongs

params.name: creator_ids
params.description: An array containing the IDs of the users who belong to this group.
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

examples:
Sample Request:
{
  "course_id": 234,
  "name": "Test Group 1",
  "creator_ids": [4499, 4506, 4503]
}
Sample Response:

{
    "id": 830,
    "name": "Test Group 1",
    "creator_ids": [
        4499,
        4506,
        4503
    ],
    "course_id": 234,
    "first_name": "Test Group 1",
    "members": [
        "Claude Erdman",
        "Nigel Gulgowski",
        "Wilhelmine Hackett"
    ]
}

projects.name: Projects
projects.full_description: Projects belong to courses. Course creators and groups have submissions for projects. Projects are generally managed by course evaluators and assistants.

params.description: The key here can be project, user_project, or group_project

params.name: type
params.description: The type of Project
params.validator: Must be one of: UserProject, GroupProject, OpenProject.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the project

params.name: description
params.description: Some information about the project

params.name: course_id
params.description: The ID of the course to which the project belongs

params.name: rubric_id
params.description: If the project uses a scoring rubric, the ID of the rubric

params.name: listing_order_position
params.description: The order of the project within the course

params.name: allowed_attachment_families
params.description: The kinds of attachments that are accepted for this project; if an empty array, all types are accepted
params.validator: Must be one of: audio, image, video.

params.name: due_date
params.description: The date after which no more assets may be attached to the project

params.name: settings
params.description: Project settings

params.name: enable_creator_attach
params.description: Whether or not the project allows creators to attach media
params.validator: Must be one of: true, false.

params.name: enable_self_evaluation
params.description: Whether or not the project allows self evaluation
params.validator: Must be one of: true, false.

params.name: enable_peer_review
params.description: Whether or not the project allows peer review
params.validator: Must be one of: true, false.

params.name: enable_public_discussion
params.description: Whether or not the project allows public discusion
params.validator: Must be one of: true, false.

params.name: reject_past_due_media
params.description: Whether or not the project should reject media after due date
params.validator: Must be one of: true, false.

params.name: anonymous_peer_review
params.description: Whetehr or not peer reviews are anonymous
params.validator: Must be one of: true, false.

examples:
Sample Request: { "project": { "name": "Test Project", "description": "Project description...", "course_id": 234, "type": "UserProject", "rubric_id": null, "allowed_attachment_families": ["image", "audio"], "due_date": "2015-04-23T18:25:43.511Z", "settings": { "enable_creator_attach": true, "enable_self_evaluation": false, "enable_peer_review": true, "enable_public_discussion": true, "reject_past_due_media": false, "anonymous_peer_review": true } } } Sample Response: { "id": 486, "name": "Test Project", "description": "

", "listing_order_position": "last", "evaluatable": false, "evaluatable_by_peers": true, "evaluatable_by_creator": false, "allows_public_discussion": true, "rejects_past_due_media": false, "allowed_attachment_families": [ "image", "audio" ], "allowed_extensions": [ "gif", "jpg", "jpeg", "png", "tif", "tiff", "mp3,", "wav" ], "allowed_mime_types": [ "image/gif", "image/jpg", "image/jpeg", "image/png", "image/tiff", "audio/mp3,", "audio/wav" ], "type": "UserProject", "rubric_id": null, "rubric_name": null, "abilities": { "can_update": true, "can_destroy": true, "can_evaluate": true, "can_show_submissions": true }, "course_id": 234, "due_date": "2015-04-23", "rubric": null }

rubrics.name: Rubrics
rubrics.full_description:
Rubrics are composed of ranges and criteria. Each range/criteria intersection is a cell. A cell may have a description. Ranges have high and low values, as well as names. For a project to be evaluated, it must have a rubric. Evaluations are closely tied to the rubric, as the rubric defines the criteria on which the submissino is to be evaluated. Rubrics can be owned by individual users, or they can be public rubrics which are available to any user in Vocat.

This API is still relatively unstable and subject to change. Tread carefully and contact the Vocat development team prior to relying heavily on this API.

methods.name: index
methods.full_description: If the current user is an administrator, this endpoint will return all public rubrics in the installation. If the user is an evaluator, the endpoint returns that users rubrics. Creator users will receive an access denied response.

errors.description: The current user is not an administrator or an evaluator.

methods.name: show
methods.full_description: Nota bene:: All rubrics in Vocat are effectively public to all users with accounts in Vocat. Vocat does not check to make sure a student is in a course using a rubric before returning it.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the rubric to be shown

methods.name: create

errors.description: There was an error creating the rubric.

params.description: The lowest possible scoe

params.name: public

params.validator: Must be one of: true, false.

params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.description: The lowest score that falls within this range

params.name: high

params.description: An array of the rubric's fields
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

scores.name: Scores
scores.full_description: Scores is a pseudo resource that is used to access aggregate scoring data. This is a read-only resource, then, for all user types.

submissions.name: Submissions
submissions.full_description: Submissions tie together the media, discussion posts, and evaluations that are created in response to a student's work on a project. Submissions are created automatically, on the fly by Vocat. Vocat will always return a one submission for every group and student that can submit for a given project. The existence of a submission, then, should not be taken to mean that a student has taken action on a project. For performance reasons, when the API renders collections of submissions, it uses a brief serializer that does not include all submission details. To access the full details of a submission, API clients should request the single submission.

methods.name: for_course

apis.short_description: returns summaries of all submissions for the given course

params.name: course
params.description: The course ID

examples:

[
